verses.verse: And David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Is there yet <S%H3426><s%> any that is left <S%H3498><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%>, that I may shew <S%H6213><s%> him kindness <S%H2617><s%> for Jonathan's <S%H3083><s%> sake?

And there was of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%> a servant <S%H5650><s%> whose name <S%H8034><s%> was Ziba <S%H6717><s%>. And when they had called <S%H7121><s%> him unto David <S%H1732><s%>, the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him, Art thou Ziba <S%H6717><s%>? And he said <S%H559><s%>, Thy servant <S%H5650><s%> is he.

And the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Is there not <S%H657><s%> yet any <S%H376><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%>, that I may shew <S%H6213><s%> the kindness <S%H2617><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> unto him? And Ziba <S%H6717><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto the king <S%H4428><s%>, Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> hath yet a son <S%H1121><s%>, which is lame <S%H5223><s%> on his feet <S%H7272><s%>.

And the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him, Where <S%H375><s%> is he? And Ziba <S%H6717><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto the king <S%H4428><s%>, Behold, he is in the house <S%H1004><s%> of Machir <S%H4353><s%>, the son <S%H1121><s%> of Ammiel <S%H5988><s%>, in Lodebar <S%H3810><s%>.

Then king <S%H4428><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%>, and fetched <S%H3947><s%> him out of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Machir <S%H4353><s%>, the son <S%H1121><s%> of Ammiel <S%H5988><s%>, from Lodebar <S%H3810><s%>.

Now when Mephibosheth <S%H4648><s%>, the son <S%H1121><s%> of Jonathan <S%H3083><s%>, the son <S%H1121><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%>, was come <S%H935><s%> unto David <S%H1732><s%>, he fell <S%H5307><s%> on his face <S%H6440><s%>, and did reverence <S%H7812><s%>. And David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Mephibosheth <S%H4648><s%>. And he answered <S%H559><s%>, Behold thy servant <S%H5650><s%>!

And David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him, Fear <S%H3372><s%> not: for I will surely <S%H6213><s%> shew <S%H6213><s%> thee kindness <S%H2617><s%> for Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> thy father's <S%H1><s%> sake, and will restore <S%H7725><s%> thee all the land <S%H7704><s%> of Saul <S%H7586><s%> thy father <S%H1><s%>; and thou shalt eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> at my table <S%H7979><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%>.
And he bowed <S%H7812><s%> himself, and said <S%H559><s%>, What is thy servant <S%H5650><s%>, that thou shouldest look <S%H6437><s%> upon such a dead <S%H4191><s%> dog <S%H3611><s%> as I am?

Then the king <S%H4428><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> to Ziba <S%H6717><s%>, Saul's <S%H7586><s%> servant <S%H5288><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him, I have given <S%H5414><s%> unto thy master's <S%H113><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> all that pertained <S%H1961><s%> to Saul <S%H7586><s%> and to all his house <S%H1004><s%>.

Thou therefore, and thy sons <S%H1121><s%>, and thy servants <S%H5650><s%>, shall till <S%H5647><s%> the land <S%H127><s%> for him, and thou shalt bring <S%H935><s%> in the fruits, that thy master's <S%H113><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> may have food <S%H3899><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%>: but Mephibosheth <S%H4648><s%> thy master's <S%H113><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> shall eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> alway <S%H8548><s%> at my table <S%H7979><s%>. Now Ziba <S%H6717><s%> had fifteen <S%H2568><s%> <S%H6240><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> and twenty <S%H6242><s%> servants <S%H5650><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> Ziba <S%H6717><s%> unto the king <S%H4428><s%>, According to all that my lord <S%H113><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> hath commanded <S%H6680><s%> his servant <S%H5650><s%>, so shall thy servant <S%H5650><s%> do <S%H6213><s%>. As for Mephibosheth <S%H4648><s%>, said the king, he shall eat <S%H398><s%> at my table <S%H7979><s%>, as one <S%H259><s%> of the king's <S%H4428><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%>.

And Mephibosheth <S%H4648><s%> had a young <S%H6996><s%> son <S%H1121><s%>, whose name <S%H8034><s%> was Micha <S%H4316><s%>. And all that dwelt <S%H4186><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%> of Ziba <S%H6717><s%> were servants <S%H5650><s%> unto Mephibosheth <S%H4648><s%>.

So Mephibosheth <S%H4648><s%> dwelt <S%H3427><s%> in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>: for he did eat <S%H398><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%> at the king's <S%H4428><s%> table <S%H7979><s%>; and was lame <S%H6455><s%> on both <S%H8147><s%> his feet <S%H7272><s%>.
